newsitem.title: USA: Micron Electronics to buy NetFrame.
newsitem.headline: Micron Electronics to buy NetFrame.

text.p: Micron Electronics Inc, the computer maker majority-owned by semiconductor giant Micron Technology Inc, on Tuesday said it will acquire NetFrame Systems Inc for about $14 million in cash.
The acquisition will occur through a tender offer of $1.00 a share to NetFrame stockholders, Micron said in a statement.
The deal has been okayed by the boards of both companies, but is subject to other customary approvals and conditions.
NetFrame makes enterprise-class multiprocessor computer servers. The merger will create a premier supplier of computer systems, notebooks, desktops and servers.
"Micron Electronics and NetFRAME Systems are an excellent fit in terms of products and market focus," said Joe Daltoso, Micron Electronics chairman.
The deal gives Micron an immediate entry into the high-end enterprise server market, giving its direct business customers access to a full line of computers.
NetFrame shares were off 5/16 at one by mid-morning. Micron Electronics shares were off 1/16 at 16-15/16.
